article.headline: Boeing, 3M share gains contribute to Dow's nearly 350-point rally
article.body: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is rallying Wednesday morning with shares of Boeing and 3M seeing positive growth for the price-weighted average. The Dow DJIA, +0.56% was most recently trading 345 points higher (1.2%), as shares of Boeing BA, -0.39% and 3M MMM, +0.94% are contributing to the index's intraday rally. Boeing's shares have gained $4.56 (2.9%) while those of 3M have climbed $3.56, or 2.2%, combining for an approximately 53-point bump for the Dow. Other components contributing significantly to the gain include Honeywell International Inc. HON, +0.34%, Caterpillar CAT, +1.45%, and Salesforce.com Inc. CRM, +2.21%. A $1 move in any one of the 30 components of the benchmark results in a 6.58-point swing. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
